title: Center of mass - spheres moved toward each other

content.question: Two spheres, with masses indicated in the figure, are initially at the positions on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis shown in the top figure. Each sphere is then moved a distance <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></math> toward the other, as shown in the bottom figure. Which of the following correctly indicates how the location of the center of mass of the two-sphere system changes between the top figure and the bottom figure?

choices.label: Moves to the left by an amount less than <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></math>
Moves to the left by an amount greater than <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></math>
Moves to the right by an amount less than <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></math>
Moves to the right by an amount greater than <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></math>

content.answer: Moves to the left by an amount less than <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
